messages.body: $TSLA  #Tesla Jumps On Positive Comments From Analyst; Investors Beware - https://goo.gl/VXxYGs

links.title: Tesla Motors, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) Jumps On Positive Comments From Analyst; Investors Beware
links.description: Published By News Desk at December 6, 2016 06:05 am A knee-jerk reaction on Monday saw shares for Tesla Motors Inc ( NASDAQ:TSLA) soaring 2.94% higher to $186.80 as investors reacted to positive comments from Trip Chowdhry - a well-known Wall Street analyst, perhaps with not the best of a track record for his calls on Tesla stock.

messages.body: $TSLA But are those jobs really worth it with public investors providing $2B-$3B a yr in free financing for a biz that only produces loses?

links.title: Want to Bring Back Jobs, Mr. President-Elect? Call Elon Musk
links.description: After the factory is complete, 95 percent of the parts contained in Tesla vehicles will be made in the United States. His company's leading-edge advances have pushed the entire auto industry to innovate, with rivals seeking to copy many of Tesla's best features.

links.title: Want to Bring Back Jobs, Mr. President-Elect? Call Elon Musk
links.description: PALO ALTO, Calif. - Donald Trump: Please think about calling Elon Musk. President-elect Trump has spent a lot of time talking about how he plans to reinvigorate the manufacturing sector, repeatedly telling the public on the campaign trail, "We are going to bring back jobs that have been stolen from you."

message.body: $TSLA Will Tesla Burn Through Its Remaining Cash? - Forbes  http://www.forbes.com/sites/petercohan/2016/12/06/will-tesla-burn-through-its-remaining-cash/#e4d2ca6501d7

links.title: Will Tesla Burn Through Its Remaining Cash?
links.description: A $9 million hedge fund concluded that Tesla Motors -- in which I have no financial interest -- will burn through its cash. The key assumption underlying that conclusion is that if charges $35,000 for its Model 3, Tesla will lose so much money that its cash will go up in flames.

links.title: Ivanka Trump to meet with Al Gore to discuss 'climate issues'
links.description: President-elect Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump is scheduled to meet Monday with Al Gore, the former Democratic vice president who has become a leading activist in the fight against global warming, to discuss "climate issues," according to the president-elect's spokesman.

links.title: Clean Disruption - Why Energy & Transportation will be Obsolete by 2030 - Oslo, March 2016
links.description: Tony Seba's Clean Disruption Keynote presentation at the Swedbank Nordic Energy Summit in Oslo, Norway, March 17th, 2016. The keynote, based on the book 'Clean Disruption of Energy and Transportation' assert that four technology categories will disrupt energy and transportation by: 1- Batteries / Energy Storage 2- Electric Vehicles 3- Self-Driving Vehicles 4- Solar Energy The outcome of the Clean Disruption is that by 2030 * All new vehicles will be electric.

message.body: $TSLA  Tesla Trading In No-Man's Land: 2 Chart Areas To Watch (archives) - https://www.seeitmarket.com/where-tesla-motors-stock-headed-post-solarcity-merger-16307/

links.title: Where Is Tesla Motors (TSLA) Stock Headed Post SolarCity Merger?
links.description: Since going public more than 6 years ago, Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) has been a battleground stock between the bulls and bears. The $29B electric car maker has soared an astounding 1057% since the IPO, which can largely be attributed to Elon Musk's leadership and the potential of the electric car market and its Gigafactory.

links.title: Ivanka Trump meeting with Al Gore on climate change
links.description: Trump spokesman Jason Miller told reporters on a daily briefing call that the meeting would be about climate issues, but he did not know what specifically was on the agenda. He also said the former Democratic vice president would not meet with Trump himself.

links.title: Tesla Model S driver walks away from crash with a truck at 'tremendous speed'
links.description: Earlier this week, the fact that the Tesla Model S broke the machine used to test the roof structure of cars during a round of tests by US regulators came up again on social media despite having happened over 3 years ago.
